did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Typescript, from a tape recording, of Heffner's experiences as manager of the Empire Ranch, 1893-1905

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Reminiscences about Empire Ranch (AZ 021). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Born in Columbus, Ohio in 1874. When Heffner was 10 years old he and his family moved to California in 1884. As young man he worked as a bookkeeper at the First National Bank in Los Angeles, California. After the bank closed in 1893, Heffner asked one of the banks customer's, Walter Vail (owner of the Empire Ranch) if he had any work for him. Thus began his career in the cattle business. Heffner served as the manger of the Vail and Gates Empire Ranch, Pima County, Ariz. from 1893 to 1905. Heffner was one of the founding members of the Arizona Cattle Growers' Association and served as it's first secretary.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into arranged in narrative sequence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Typescript, from a tape recording, of Heffner's experiences as manager of the Empire Ranch, as told to Charles U. Pickrell, Tucson, Ariz., 1960. Accompanied by a letter of transmittal from Pickrell, dated Sept. 2, 1961.

relatedmaterial.p: A digitized transcript of the interview can be found as part of University of Arizona Institutional Repository (UAir) underEmpire Ranch Collection
